meanings.definition: Ionogens: substances that produce ions when dissolved in water.
meanings.sent1: The chemist studied different ionogens in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Ionogens are commonly found in salts and acids.
meanings.sent3: The ionogens in the solution decided to have a party and dance around.
meanings.sent4: The ionogens in the mixture were like tiny dancers, moving and interacting.
meanings.sent5: When you mix these ionogens, it's like a colorful explosion of tiny particles.

meanings.sent1: The ionogens reaction was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: Water can interact with ionogens to create charged particles.
meanings.sent3: The ionogens in the experiment were feeling electrifyingly charged.
meanings.sent4: Her words had an ionogens effect on the audience, sparking curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The ionogens properties of the material made it ideal for conducting electricity.
